natural_language: never broadcast a datagram on the hardware network it was received on
atomic_propositions: datagram_received_on_network, broadcast_datagram_on_network
ltl_explanation: Globally: if a datagram is received on a network, it must not be broadcast on that same network

natural_language: If the datagram is received on the hardware network to which it is addressed, then it should not be forwarded
atomic_propositions: datagram_received_on_addressed_network, forward_datagram
ltl_explanation: Globally: if a datagram is received on the network it's addressed to, it must not be forwarded

natural_language: the gateway should consider itself to be a destination of the datagram
atomic_propositions: gateway_considers_self_destination
ltl_explanation: Globally: the gateway should always consider itself to be a destination of the datagram

natural_language: if the datagram is addressed to a hardware network to which the gateway is connected, it should be sent as a (data link layer) broadcast on that network
atomic_propositions: datagram_addressed_to_connected_network, send_as_datalink_broadcast
ltl_explanation: Globally: if a datagram is addressed to a connected network, it should be sent as a data link layer broadcast

natural_language: the gateway should consider itself a destination of the datagram
atomic_propositions: gateway_considers_self_destination
ltl_explanation: Globally: the gateway should always consider itself a destination of the datagram

natural_language: the gateway should use its normal routing procedure to choose a subsequent gateway, and send the datagram along to it
atomic_propositions: use_normal_routing_procedure, send_datagram_to_next_gateway
ltl_explanation: Globally: the gateway should use normal routing procedure and send datagram to next gateway

natural_language: The address 255.255.255.255 denotes a broadcast on a local hardware network, which must not be forwarded
atomic_propositions: address_is_broadcast_address, forward_datagram
ltl_explanation: Globally: if address is the broadcast address 255.255.255.255, the datagram must not be forwarded

natural_language: a host should discard datagrams not meant for it without becoming flustered
atomic_propositions: datagram_not_meant_for_host, discard_datagram
ltl_explanation: Globally: if a datagram is not meant for the host, the host should discard it

natural_language: The receiving IP layer must be able to recognize this address as well as its own
atomic_propositions: recognize_broadcast_address, recognize_own_address
ltl_explanation: Globally: the IP layer must recognize both the broadcast address and its own address

natural_language: MUST respond to commands in the order they are received from the client.
atomic_propositions: command_received_from_client, command_queued_for_processing, response_generated, response_sent_to_client, command_processing_started, command_processing_completed, commands_pending_in_queue, fifo_order_maintained, earlier_command_exists
ltl_explanation: Always: if a command is received and there's an earlier command, then when processing starts, FIFO order must be maintained

natural_language: SHOULD elect to store responses to grouped RSET, MAIL FROM, SEND FROM, SOML FROM, SAML FROM, and RCPT TO commands in an internal buffer so they can sent as a unit.
atomic_propositions: rset_command_received, mail_from_command_received, send_from_command_received, soml_from_command_received, saml_from_command_received, rcpt_to_command_received, commands_are_grouped, response_generated, response_stored_in_buffer, internal_buffer_exists, responses_sent_as_unit, grouped_commands_complete
ltl_formula: G ((commands_are_grouped & (rset_command_received | mail_from_command_received | send_from_command_received | soml_from_command_received | saml_from_command_received | rcpt_to_command_received)) -> (response_generated -> response_stored_in_buffer))
ltl_explanation: Always: when commands are grouped and any of the specified commands are received, responses should be stored in buffer rather than sent immediately

natural_language: SHOULD issue a positive response to the DATA command if and only if one or more valid RCPT TO addresses have been previously received.
atomic_propositions: data_command_received, positive_response_issued, valid_rcpt_to_received, rcpt_to_command_processed, rcpt_to_address_valid, negative_response_issued
ltl_explanation: Always: when DATA command is received, positive response is issued if and only if valid RCPT TO addresses were previously received

natural_language: MUST NOT, after issuing a positive response to a DATA command with no valid recipients and subsequently receiving an empty message, send any message whatsoever to anybody.
atomic_propositions: server_issues_positive_response_to_data, data_command_has_no_valid_recipients, server_receives_empty_message, server_sends_message_to_anyone, positive_response_issued, empty_message_received
ltl_explanation: Always: if server issues positive response to DATA with no valid recipients and receives empty message, then always never send any message to anybody

natural_language: MUST NOT buffer responses to EHLO, DATA, VRFY, EXPN, TURN, QUIT, and NOOP.
atomic_propositions: client_sends_ehlo, client_sends_data, client_sends_vrfy, client_sends_expn, client_sends_turn, client_sends_quit, client_sends_noop, server_buffers_ehlo_response, server_buffers_data_response, server_buffers_vrfy_response, server_buffers_expn_response, server_buffers_turn_response, server_buffers_quit_response, server_buffers_noop_response, response_is_buffered
ltl_explanation: Always: responses to EHLO, DATA, VRFY, EXPN, TURN, QUIT, and NOOP commands must not be buffered

natural_language: MUST NOT buffer responses to unrecognized commands.
atomic_propositions: command_received, command_is_recognized, command_is_unrecognized, response_generated, response_buffered, response_sent_immediately, buffer_contains_response
ltl_explanation: Always: if an unrecognized command is received, the response must not be buffered

natural_language: MUST send all pending responses immediately whenever the local TCP input buffer is emptied.
atomic_propositions: local_tcp_input_buffer_emptied, pending_responses_exist, send_pending_responses, responses_sent_immediately, local_tcp_input_buffer_empty, all_pending_responses_sent
ltl_explanation: Always: when TCP input buffer is emptied and pending responses exist, they must be sent immediately

natural_language: MUST NOT make assumptions about commands that are yet to be received.
atomic_propositions: assumption_made_about_future_command, command_received, command_pending_receipt, system_processes_known_commands_only, future_command_predicted, decision_based_on_unreceived_command
ltl_explanation: Always: never make assumptions about commands that are yet to be received

natural_language: MUST NOT flush or otherwise lose the contents of the TCP input buffer under any circumstances whatsoever.
atomic_propositions: tcp_input_buffer_flushed, tcp_input_buffer_contents_lost, tcp_input_buffer_has_data, tcp_input_buffer_empty, tcp_connection_active, tcp_connection_reset, tcp_connection_closed, system_error_occurs, memory_pressure_high, tcp_stack_shutdown
ltl_explanation: Always: never flush the TCP input buffer or lose its contents under any circumstances

natural_language: SHOULD issue response text that indicates, either implicitly or explicitly, what command the response matches.
atomic_propositions: system_receives_command, system_issues_response, response_contains_text, response_explicitly_indicates_matched_command, response_implicitly_indicates_matched_command, command_response_mapping_exists
ltl_explanation: Always: when system issues a response, it should indicate (explicitly or implicitly) what command the response matches

natural_language: Client SMTP implementations that employ pipelining MUST check ALL statuses associated with each command in a group.
atomic_propositions: client_uses_pipelining, commands_grouped_in_pipeline, status_received_for_command, client_checks_command_status, all_statuses_checked, command_group_complete
ltl_explanation: Always: if client uses pipelining and command group is complete, all statuses associated with each command must be checked

natural_language: Command statuses MUST be coordinated with responses by counting each separate response and correlating that count with the number of commands.
atomic_propositions: command_issued, response_received, command_count_incremented, response_count_incremented, command_count_equals_response_count, command_response_correlation_performed, command_status_coordinated, counting_mechanism_active
ltl_explanation: Always: when counting mechanism is active, commands and responses must be counted and eventually correlated
